body: While these tests were probably very helpful for developing the code, they are not needed as unit tests when checking this into TensorFlow. The standard approach is to have a test that compares the analytical gradients against a finite difference approximation. This functionality is provided by the tf.test.compute_gradient_error() method. You can find plenty of examples in tensorflow/python/ops/*_grad_test.py.

This functionality is provided by the tf.test.compute_gradient_error() method. You can find plenty of examples in tensorflow/python/ops/*_grad_test.py.
body_text: While these tests were probably very helpful for developing the code, they are not needed as unit tests when checking this into TensorFlow. The standard approach is to have a test that compares the analytical gradients against a finite difference approximation. This functionality is provided by the tf.test.compute_gradient_error() method. You can find plenty of examples in tensorflow/python/ops/*_grad_test.py.
